noun.description: A call to take part in a contest or competition, especially a duel.
An objection or query as to the truth of something, often with an implicit demand for proof.
examples: a challenge to the legality of the order

noun.description: Exposure of the immune system to pathogenic organisms or antigens.
examples: recently vaccinated calves should be protected from challenge

verb.description: Invite (someone) to engage in a contest.
examples: he challenged one of my men to a duel

verb.description: Dispute the truth or validity of.
Expose (the immune system) to pathogenic organisms or antigens.

origin: Middle English (in the senses accusation and accuse): from Old French chalenge (noun), chalenger (verb), from Latin calumnia calumny, calumniari calumniate.
